column5: Well it's been a long time coming, our annual trip WAY NORTH where the wildlife is abundant and the fish big (except this year) lol... I normally write up a nice long report but this year I decided to take video footage to edit and share with you guys.  Hope you enjoy...we sure did!!!  I was a little nervous when I realized how close I was to that bear....my wife was freaking on my   , not the smartest thing I've done but the wind was perfect....to get within 30-35ft    Jason  P.S.-How to you provide the above link to the video on Youtube with the actual video showing up on OFC, simply click and play? Can't seem to figure it out and I know it's relatively simple I'm sure!!!

Very nice... at one point that Bear just sat here looking at you...NO wonder your wife was freaking...lol Thanks for shareing <iframe width="560" height="349" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/AY4i1sjk964" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Excellent report,   hats off to you! Usually turn the music down on these but that tune was perfect. What a great looking trip.
Did the bear at any point make a sound that may have sounded like "TJ???".
Great video. How long did you stay for?
nice video
Great video  I like the extending arm for the camera while you're in the boat - cool idea
That was an awesome vid. You had me once I seen the hat there bye.  The grouse shot was great. Loved the theme music,made the vid very enjoyable.  Thanks for sharing.
Very nice!
awesome video and trip
Absolutely beautiful trip!! You sure don't pack light! lol

Thanks everyone, really enjoyed putting it together over the last few days.  Hey Nip.....we were only gone for 5 days this year....usually 8-10 days  Hey Wayne....pack light....I did..left the wood stove home this year!!!lol  Jason
Oh well.. there's lots of room to run around in that tent if you/she gets cold !!

Hey Jason!  Excellent video!!!  Looked like a great time with lots of great memories there.  After hearing your last bear story from that fly-in lake, I don't blame her for getting on you about the bear...LOL!
Nice video. I'm guessing the HD GoPro Camera and a Standard def camera. Just wondering what software you used to edit the 2 formats? Thanks for the report.
Well done - thanks for sharing !!
I used Trak AXPC....pretty impressive software for only $30.00
That was a cool video. You really know how to camp in style. Great set up at camp. I could stay there forever.
I usually skip the vids but i'm glad i watched this one. Looks like an awesome trip
great video, what kind of mount did you have while filming your boat ride ?
It's actually the Go Pro HD mount, but I did some modifications to attach it to a extendable painters pole.
Thanks for the info Jason.
That's the way to do it
Very nice Jay.  Sharing some quality outdoor time with the wife safe in your wicked Fort Knox tent is the way to go man.  Enjoyed the video a tonne.
That was great ! Thanks for sharing
